Articles.Content: I was thinking about getting 6.4x KSP and i saw that it changes the gravity of some objects. Does this mean it will be incompatible with MechJeb?
Mechjeb does not care if the world is x1, x6.4, reall size, or 1/10. It reads the value from the game, so it is always up to date.

> 
> Mechjeb does not care if the world is x1, x6.4, reall size, or 1/10. It reads the value from the game, so it is always up to date.

Prediction of landing location on bodies with an atmosphere doesn't match up though.
No, they do. Unless you play with FAR, which you undoubtfully do with a larger world. This has nothing to do with world size.

Do you mean KSP x64? That shouldn't change any of the planets, but MechJeb does work with it, unlike many mods.

However the 64-bit version of KSP is buggier in general.

Or do you mean the Rescaled Solar System mod (or whatever it's called)?

> 
> No, they do. Unless you play with FAR, which you undoubtfully do with a larger world. This has nothing to do with world size.

Ah yes, my bad.
